subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Tony DeMaria, an assistant at Willow Ridge, posted the biggest victory of his professional career with a wire-to-wire triumph for a one-under-par 215 total in the 2007 Lincoln Met P.G.A. Championship at The Stanwich Club om Greenwich, Conn. DeMaria started with 70-68 in the first two rounds and then held on as Rick Hartmann of the Atlantic Golf Club came charging from 10 shots behind. DeMaria parred his final five holes to hold on with a 77 by one stroke while Hartmann had birdies on Nos. 16 and 17 en route to a tournament-low round of 67. Keith Dicciani of Metropolis finished alone in third place at one over. DeMaria won $15,000.
